data.title: Yard Sale
data.statement:
At a yard sale, each item costs {{$5}}. Customers are standing in a queue to buy from you one at a time (in the order specified by [[bills]]). Each customer will only buy one item and pay with either a {{$5}}, {{$10}}, or {{$20}} bill. You must provide the correct change to each customer so that the net transaction is that the customer pays {{$5}}.

Note that you do not have any change in hand at first.

Determine the number of each type of bill you will have after the entire queue of customers has paid, or output {{Not enough change!}} if it is impossible to give the right amount of change to one of the customers.

<<Example:>>
Input: [[bills]] = {{5 10 20}}
Output: {{Not enough change!}}
Explanation: 
From the first customer, you collect one $5 bill.
For the next customer, you collect a $10 bill and give back a $5 bill.
For the last customer, you cannot give $15 of change back because you only have a $10 bill.
Thus, the output is {{Not enough change!}}.

<<Example:>>
Input: [[bills]] = {{5 5 10}}
Output: {{1 1 0}}
Explanation: 
From the first customer, you collect one $5 bill.
For the next customer, you collect another $5 bill.
For the last customer, you collect a $10 and give back a $5 bill.
Since there are no more customers left, the output should be the number of each bill.
You have 1 $5 bill, 1 $10 bill, and 0 $20 bills. Therefore the output is {{1 1 0}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loopline n x:int
write Not enough change!
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of customers
<<Line 2:>> [[n]] space-separated integers representing [[bills]] where [[bills[i]]] is the bill the i'th customer pays
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> {{3}} space-separated integers denoting the number of {{$5}}, {{$10}}, and {{$20}} bills respectively, if you can provide every customer with the correct change, or {{Not enough change!}} otherwise.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

At a yard sale, each item costs $5. Customers are standing in a queue to buy from you one at a time (in the order specified by bills). Each customer will only buy one item and pay with either a $5, $10, or $20 bill. You must provide the correct change to each customer so that the net transaction is that the customer pays $5.

Note that you do not have any change in hand at first.

Determine the number of each type of bill you will have after the entire queue of customers has paid, or output Not enough change! if it is impossible to give the right amount of change to one of the customers.

Example:
Input: bills = 5 10 20
Output: Not enough change!
Explanation:
From the first customer, you collect one $5 bill.
For the next customer, you collect a $10 bill and give back a $5 bill.
For the last customer, you cannot give $15 of change back because you only have a $10 bill.
Thus, the output is Not enough change!.

Example:
Input: bills = 5 5 10
Output: 1 1 0
Explanation:
From the first customer, you collect one $5 bill.
For the next customer, you collect another $5 bill.
For the last customer, you collect a $10 and give back a $5 bill.
Since there are no more customers left, the output should be the number of each bill.
You have 1 $5 bill, 1 $10 bill, and 0 $20 bills. Therefore the output is 1 1 0.
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of customers
Line 2: n space-separated integers representing bills where bills[i] is the bill the i'th customer pays
Output
Line 1: 3 space-separated integers denoting the number of $5, $10, and $20 bills respectively, if you can provide every customer with the correct change, or Not enough change! otherwise.
Constraints
0 < n <= 50
bills[i] is either 5, 10, or 20
Example
Input
3
5 10 20
Output
Not enough change!
